ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Oddball Task - Emotional type of the stimulus shown
Notes: 2= Standard square stimulus; 3= Emotional stimulus; 4= Neutrally charged stimulus; 5= Target circle stimulus

ElementDescription: Oddball Task - Response of the participant to stimulus
Notes: 1= First button indicated on chronos device; 2= Second button indicated on chronos device

ElementDescription: Oddball Task - Correct response to stimulus
Notes: 1= Correct response for oddball_stimulus_type 2-4 (standard square, emotional, neutrally charged stimulus); 2= Correct response for oddball_stimulus_type 5 (target circle stimulus)

ElementDescription: Oddball Task - Input response time for 1500ms stimulus window
Notes: In milliseconds (ms); Blank= participant presses no button, the device does not register a button press, or participant presses a button on the device which is not indicated

ElementDescription: Oddball Task - Average Heart Rate of the participant during 1500ms stimulus window in beats per minute (BPM)
Oddball Task - Average Skin Conductance of participant during 1500ms stimulus window in microsiemens (μS)
